resources.string: Have you read Szymborska, Gombrowicz, Lem, Miłosz or maybe Sapkowski? But how much do you really know about Polish literature? Check it out.
The first sentence written down in Polish in Book of Henrykow.
When was the first sentence in Polish language – „Day, ut ia pobrusa, a ti poziwai” (eng. “Let me, I shall grind, and you take a rest”) – written down?
How many Poles received the Nobel Prize for literature?
If you knew the answer to the previous question, this one should be easy… Which Poles received the Nobel Prize for literature? (More than one answer is correct.)
Which famous fantasy character was created by Andrzej Sapkowski?
Which poet wrote the famous Polish tongue twister “W Szczebrzeszynie chrząszcz brzmi w trzcinie”?
The national epic of Poland opens with invocation to… Lithuania. Who wrote it?
Which comics\’ character has something in common with Poland?
Want to reset the quiz? Click once more.

Thank you for taking part in Polish Literature Quiz.\n\n
You cannot know the answers yet. Click submit button first.

Q1. The first sentence in Polish was written down in 1270 in “Book of Henryków” – a Latin chronicle of the Cistercian abbey in Henryków in Lower Silesia. 

Q2. The Nobel Prize for literature received four Poles. 

Q3. They were: Henryk Sienkiewicz (1905), Władysław Reymont (1924), Czesław Miłosz (1980) and Wisława Szymborska (1996). 

Q4. The Witcher Geralt of Rivia was created by Andrzej Sapkowski. 

Q5. You can thank Jan Brzechwa for this beautiful sentence you'll never pronounce well, if you're not Polish. 

Q6. “Pan Tadeusz” was written by Adam Mickiewicz. Legend has it only Polish literature students read it all. 

Q7. Thorgal is a Belgian fantasy comic book series by the Belgian writer Jean Van Hamme and the Polish graphic artist Grzegorz Rosiński. 

Now you know more! :)
